result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L. Konecny was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher L. Konecny is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher L. Konecny was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:00 am - DA calls cases 16CM54 and 16CM55 and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Christopher L. Konecny appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA certifies victims rights compliance on both cases.  Court orders amendment on 16CM55 to PF ordinance 11-2-8(a).    DE enters plea of GUILTY to the amended charge.  Court assesses fine of $377.50 and grants pay plan of $100 per month beginning 9/30/16 and each month thereafter or CO.  On  16CM54, court questions DE regarding right to atty.  DE waives right to attorney.  DE enters plea of GUILTY to count 1.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Ct 1 of 16CM54, and on motion of DA dismisses Ct 2.  DE to submit DNA sample to PRSO.  Court imposes:

Sentence withheld - 1 year probation
Conditions of probation
Enroll and successfully complete the next Batterer's Group
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.
DE must submit an apology to victim/victims in way and manner to be determined by probation agent.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
$243 court costs
$100 DOMAB
$200 DNAAS

Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 24, 2016 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher L. Konecny
Current: 11178 Ernst Lane, Butternut, WI 54514 United States  (Effective: 07-18-2016)
Prior: W1160 N. Lake Shore Drive, Genoa City, WI 53128

Cases 16CM54 and 16CM55.   Defendant Christopher L. Konecny appeared in court. Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copies of complaints given DE.    Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.    Notice of right to attorney given to DE.  Bond to continue.
State's Demand for Discovery & Notice of intent to use DNA evidence

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  Defendant may not have contact with Amanda Stahnke, unless written consent is filed with the Clerk's office or outside business hours with the Price County Sheriff's Dept.

10:15am (16CM54 and 16CM55) Defendant Christopher L. Konecny appeared, in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called, appearances and possible charges stated.  Defendant's next court date is 6/28/16 at 10:00am.  Court gives defendant notice of right to attorney and victim/witness intimidation form.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation.  Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint.  Court sets signature bond with conditions.
